docs.lead_paragraph: The Rio 2016 organizing committee is worried about the rapid spread of the Zika virus in Brazil, but said on Tuesday it has not seen evidence of people canceling travel to the Olympics in August.

headline.main: Zika Worries Olympic Committee, Brazil Sees Dip in Travel
headline.print_headline: Zika Worries Olympic Committee, Brazil Sees Dip in Travel

docs.snippet: The Rio 2016 organizing committee is worried about the rapid spread of the Zika virus in Brazil, but said on Tuesday it has not seen evidence of people canceling travel to the Olympics in August.

docs.lead_paragraph: Chapter 32 introduced some new romantic prospects for Jane, with mixed results.

headline.main: ‘Jane the Virgin’ Season 2, Episode 10: Jane Swipes Right

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers worldwide have been observing a voluntary moratorium on changes to DNA that could be passed down to subsequent generations.

headline.main: British Researcher Gets Permission to Edit Genes of Human Embryos
headline.print_headline: Britain Allows New Method to Edit Genes

docs.abstract: British authorities approve use of genome editing technique on human embryo; experiment would not technically break scientific community's voluntary moratorium on altering heritable DNA because there are no plans to implant affected embryos in womb.
docs.snippet: Researchers worldwide have been observing a voluntary moratorium on changes to DNA that could be passed down to subsequent generations.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Nicolas Maduro's government is likely underestimating the number of Zika cases in Venezuela, which could hurt efforts to combat the virus-bearing mosquito, according to local doctors, opposition politicians and neighbouring Colombia.

headline.main: Venezuela Likely Underestimating Zika Cases-Doctors, Colombia Say
headline.print_headline: Venezuela Likely Underestimating Zika Cases-Doctors, Colombia Say

docs.snippet: President Nicolas Maduro's government is likely underestimating the number of Zika cases in Venezuela, which could hurt efforts to combat the virus-bearing mosquito, according to local doctors, opposition politicians and neighbouring Colombia.

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's decision to allow researchers to edit the genes of human embryos — not to create babies but to start unraveling the earliest stages of development — is raising new questions about the ethics of this hot new technology.

headline.main: AP News Guide: Facts About Gene Editing as Britain OKs Study
headline.print_headline: AP News Guide: Facts About Gene Editing as Britain OKs Study

docs.snippet: Britain's decision to allow researchers to edit the genes of human embryos — not to create babies but to start unraveling the earliest stages of development — is raising new questions about the ethics of this hot new technology.

headline.main: Using a Mother’s Microbes to Protect Cesarean Babies
headline.print_headline: Post-Cesarean Bacteria Transfer Could Change Health for Life, Study Shows

docs.abstract: A new study shows that a mother’s beneficial microbes can be transferred, at least partially, from her vagina to her baby after a C-section.
docs.snippet: A new study shows that a mother’s beneficial microbes can be transferred, at least partially, from her vagina to her baby after a C-section.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new documentary, “No Más Bebés,” examines a California hospital’s sterilizations of Mexican-American women in the early 1970s — and the women who filed suit in response.

headline.main: When Doctors Took ‘Family Planning’ Into Their Own Hands

docs.snippet: A new documentary, “No Más Bebés,” examines a California hospital’s sterilizations of Mexican-American women in the early 1970s — and the women who filed suit in response.

docs.lead_paragraph: Each year, an estimated 25,000 babies in the United States receive a diagnosis of microcephaly, an abnormally small head, but prognoses are hard to predict.

headline.main: Microcephaly, Spotlighted by Zika Virus, Has Long Afflicted and Mystified
headline.print_headline: Ailment Linked to Zika Epidemic Has Long Afflicted and Mystified

docs.abstract: Zika virus outbreak in Brazil and South and Central America has drawn global attention in part because of possible link to microcephaly, birth deformity that has mystified experts for decades; microcephaly is ailment that has no treatment, no cure and unclear prognosis, and while disorder may augur future brain damage, it is not necessarily indication of neurological problem.
docs.snippet: Each year, an estimated 25,000 babies in the United States receive a diagnosis of microcephaly, an abnormally small head, but prognoses are hard to predict.
